venue.address_2: If you do not read the write up- you loose out
venue.name: SEE DETAILS IN EVENT WRITEUP

item.description:
Hi Everyone,

I know most all of you are out of town and still overstuffed with the Turkey Meal which has you in a Food Coma.

Those that can still move and need to stay in shape can join me  in KEEPING FIT by hiking at Chapman Pond and if interested, visiting a few other locations of HISTORICAL interest.

Primary Destination: Chapman Pond Trails: East Haddam

There is parking at the end of an old woods road, which begins at the 90 degree turn on River Rd. about 1/4 mile from Route 82. The trail begins beyond the parking spaces.

GPS APX: 250 River Road, East Haddam,  CT

For a map of the Chapman Pond Preserves, please Click Here.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

I PERSONALLY also plan to stop to inspect the following on my return home trip if there is enough time...etc:

2. Johnsonville Ghost Town, Apx 47 Johnsonville Rd, Moodus

http://www.damnedct.com/johnsonville-east-haddam/

 

4. Bernstein Preserve

APX GPS: 108 Falls Rd, Moodus 

The 16+ acre Bernstein Preserve is a continuing effort to create a linear preserve along the scenic and historically significant Moodus River. The river winds its way back and forth along Route 149, finally feeding into Salmon Cove, and then on to the Connecticut River. The water quality of this tributary has a notable effect on the eastern portion of Salmon Cove, which provides habitat for several unusual plant species. The cove is also noted for wintering bald eagle populations, osprey and other raptors, numerous waterfowl, and abundant furbearers.

The preserve contains the remains of the old historic Atlantic Mill. The stone work, old turbines, head and tail races, sluice-way, and other mill remnants remain. Click Here for a photograph of the original mill. Click Here for an article from a recent EHLT Newsletter about the mill.

The preserve is accessed via Land Trust property that serves as a driveway for the house on the east side of Route 149/Falls Road, about 100 yards south of Andrews Road. Park off the right of the driveway. Access to the preserve is through the bar-way at the end of the driveway. For a map of the Bernstein Preserve, please Click Here.

 

 

 

 

For a later time or on my way to Chapman:

6. Hammond Mill Preserve

APX GPS:#22 Dolbia Hill Rd East Haddam

The Hammond Mill Preserve is located along the Eightmile River, south of Devil's Hopyard State Park. The 12-acre preserve is on the west side of the river, and another 2-acre easement is on the east side of the river. The preserve is mature oak/hemlock forest with a diversity of wildflowers and abundant woodland bird populations. The area is of notable historic interest, having served as a site for water-powered mills since the late 18th century. The water-powered mill was first used as a fulling mill, then a grist mill, and later as a saw mill. The old saw mill and water wheel are now located south of the Johnsonville dam off Route 149 in Moodus. The mill foundations, sluice, and remnants of the dam remain at Hammond Mill. For a map of the Hammond Mill Preserve, please Click Here.

and:

 

 

See those that are interested and I wish those that are home a good weekend.

al-r
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing an ORANGE HUNTING hat at the parking lot, and Orange striped Cone near car.
